titlestmt.titleproper: Edwin Wolf and John Fleming working papers for Rosenbach: a biography 1953-1974
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Edwin Wolf and John Fleming working papers for Rosenbach: a biography

bioghist.p: Edwin Wolf 2nd (1911-1991) was a librarian, bibliophile, author, historian, Franklin scholar, and civic leader. Wolf worked with Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach for nearly twenty years, compiling many of the company's catalogs. He was the Curator of the Library Company of Philadelphia from 1953 to 1955, and its Librarian from 1955 to 1984. John Fleming worked with Dr. Rosenbach from 1925 until the latter's death in 1952. He became a Vice President of the Rosenbach Company in 1948 and succeeded to the business in 1954. He was also a member of the Board of Trustees of the Rosenbach Foundation. Wolf and Fleming co-authored Rosenbach: A Biography, which was published in 1960.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the working papers for Wolf and Fleming's biography of A.S.W. Rosenbach. The collection includes: typescripts with annotations; page proofs; pre-publishing reader's and editor's comments; clippings of reviews; a small amount of publicity materials, including a sales brochure for the book; correspondence with publishers, reviewers, and readers; and typed and handwritten notes on Rosenbach's business transactions.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
